= **A Date Which Will Live in Infamy**
----
= //Oh, my dear//
= //Look what we've done here//
= //My greatest fear, a pain with an anchor//
= //The taste of defeat//
@@ @@
= //Oh, my dear//
= //Look what we've come to//
= //We've shattered serene//
@@ @@
= //I've turned my grief to medicine//
= //Into my mouth will enter//
= //The hardest pill I've ever had to swallow down//
= //As karma whispers//
@@ @@
= //Oh, my dear//
= //The damage is done here//
= //I disappear, a love with no anchor//
= //In the depths of the sea//
@@ @@
= â€•Brent Hinds, Bill Kelliher, Brann Dailor and Troy Sanders, //Hushed and Grim//
-----
= Written by [[*user Dr. Phil McClaw]], an actual crustacean and [[*user Rhys Tanner]], your local invading seabeast

= The edits to the "Allied Occult Command" theme were a commission graciously provided by [[*user Fantem]]. You can find her [*https://twitter.com/fantem1903 here.]
-----
This is a rewrite of an entry submitted by both authors to the DepartmentCon 2022 contest. The events of the tale are unchanged, but there are substantial changes to prose, pacing and grammar, as well as to the theme. A link to the original submitted piece can be found [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/a-date-which-will-live-in-infamy/offset/1 here.]
-----
= **Content Warnings:**
//This story contains depictions of violence. In-depth content warnings are provided below to use at your discretion.//
* **Violence:** [[span class="dblock"]]The events of a surprise military attack are described throughout. Characters are depicted drowning, being bombed, being attacked by animals and being subjected to state violence in various forms, though none of these events are described in explicit detail (a child is implied to drown at sea, for example, but the event is not actually shown or confirmed within the text).[[/span]]@@ @@
